title: Gemma Collins takes 11 suitcases on holiday and abandons unwanted luggage abroad

Gemma Collins has admitted she takes so much luggage on holiday, she often abandons her unwanted cases abroad.

The GC, 38, says she took 11 suitcases on her last trip to Los Angeles and always "overpacks" as she never knows what she's going to want to wear.

On the way home, she then leaves some of cases behind and donates them to charity.

Speaking on her BBC podcast, Gemma explained: "I always overpack. The last time I went to LA to film my show, I packed 11 suitcases.

"Every country I went to I would leave a suitcase there and give it to the local charity.

"I don't know why I do it. I always panic when I don't have choice. When I go away I like to dress to the way I'm feeling.

(Image: WENN)

"Going on holiday and having to pre-pick my clothes before I go. I just don't enjoy the experience. I'm a free spirit."

Gemma went in to admit her luggage ends up costing her at least £300-per-trip in excess luggage fees - but she always tries to get out of paying.

She added: "Honestly every time I fly, it's like £300 excess and I think 'oh no not again'.

(Image: Getty)

"I try and sweet talk them like 'if you ever need anything from me, contact my shop.

"And they are like 'no sorry it's £300' and I get there I still don't know what to wear every day.

"I don't follow fashion. I just wear what I want to wear."
